I am looking for some pointers on the best JUnit extensions and/or
patterns=
 to follow in developing concurrency tests.  Basically, for
key classes I w=
ant to take my normal single-threaded JUnit tests and
execute them simultan=
eously on multiple threads.  The goals of such a
test would be (a) to ident=
ify any concurrency issues (race conditions,
data race) and (b) to time the=
 cost of synchronization policies.

Any tips?
